revised_title: Relativistic Theory of Non-Radial Oscillations of Stars
tldr: The authors develop a complete unified theory of non-radial oscillations of a star, based on the premise that oscillations are excited by incident gravitational waves. They decouple the equations governing the metric of the space-time from the equations governing the hydrodynamical variables, reducing the problem to one in scattering theory. This approach provides a deeper understanding of the physical consequences of general relativity and offers a simpler set of equations for evaluating the complex frequencies of the quasi-normal modes.
